activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Due to the holiday period and the large volume of reports we have received, it may take us up to three weeks to respond. Thank you for your patience!
Once again, I can't reproduce a crash. Can you check whether you're able to reproduce a crash with a stock MRuby?

Hi. I'm able to reproduce here, across different machines. Double checked also w/ another hunter.

Compliled in gcc following the github compile instructions.

```
vagrant@vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64:~/mruby$ ./bin/mruby -v
mruby 1.2.0 (2015-11-17)

vagrant@vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64:~/mruby$ ./bin/mruby 17.crash
trace:
	[0] 17.crash:15
17.crash:15: undefined method 't' for main (NoMethodError)
mruby: malloc.c:3987: _int_free: Assertion `p->fd_nextsize->bk_nextsize == p' failed.
Aborted
```
Could you also provide the git SHA of the version you're testing with? Thanks.
Thanks for the additional details. I wasn't observing a crash on OS X but switched to Ubuntu and now I'm able to reproduce it.
Nice. Let me know if you need something else.
Thanks again for your report. We've reproduced the crash, and opened an issue upstream: https://github.com/mruby/mruby/issues/3387
Issue resolved. Can you double check it?

Thanks again for your report. As you noted, this issue was resolved upstream in https://github.com/mruby/mruby/commit/db1bd078bedcc33bfd3ca4c45f46bc553786bfd8.

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we'll be in touch with you again soon.
Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify and the Mruby project!
